verses.verse: You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> your brother's <S%H251><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his sheep <S%H7716><s%> go astray, <S%H5080><s%> and hide <S%H5956><s%> yourself from them: you shall in any case <S%H7725><s%> bring <S%H7725><s%> them again <S%H7725><s%> to your brother. <S%H251><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> your brother <S%H251><s%> be not near <S%H7126><s%> to you, or if you know <S%H3045><s%> him not, then you shall bring <S%H622><s%> it to your own house, <S%H1004><s%> and it shall be with you until <S%H5704><s%> your brother <S%H251><s%> seek <S%H1875><s%> after it, and you shall restore <S%H7725><s%> it to him again. <S%H7725><s%>

In like <S%H3651><s%> manner <S%H3651><s%> shall you do <S%H6213><s%> with his ass; <S%H2543><s%> and so <S%H3651><s%> shall you do <S%H6213><s%> with his raiment; <S%H8071><s%> and with all <S%H3605><s%> lost <S%H9><s%> thing of your brother's, <S%H251><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he has lost, <S%H6><s%> and you have found, <S%H4672><s%> shall you do <S%H6213><s%> likewise: <S%H3651><s%> you may <S%H3201><s%> not hide <S%H5956><s%> yourself.

You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> your brother's <S%H251><s%> ass <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his ox <S%H7794><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> down by the way, <S%H1870><s%> and hide <S%H5956><s%> yourself from them: you shall surely help <S%H6965><s%> him to lift <S%H6965><s%> them up again.

The woman <S%H802><s%> shall not wear <S%H1961><s%> <S%H5921><s%> that which pertains <S%H3627><s%> to a man, <S%H1397><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall a man <S%H1397><s%> put <S%H3847><s%> on a woman's <S%H802><s%> garment: <S%H8071><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> that do <S%H6213><s%> so <S%H428><s%> are abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a bird's <S%H6833><s%> nest <S%H7064><s%> chance <S%H7122><s%> to be before <S%H6440><s%> you in the way <S%H1870><s%> in any <S%H3605><s%> tree, <S%H6086><s%> or <S%H176><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> the ground, <S%H776><s%> whether they be young <S%H667><s%> ones, or <S%H176><s%> eggs, <S%H1000><s%> and the dam <S%H517><s%> sitting <S%H7257><s%> on the young, <S%H667><s%> or <S%H176><s%> on the eggs, <S%H1000><s%> you shall not take <S%H3947><s%> the dam <S%H517><s%> with the young: <S%H1121><s%>

But you shall in any wise let the dam <S%H517><s%> go, <S%H7971><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> the young <S%H1121><s%> to you; that it may be well <S%H3190><s%> with you, and that you may prolong <S%H748><s%> your days. <S%H3117><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> you build <S%H1129><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> then you shall make <S%H6213><s%> a battlement <S%H4624><s%> for your roof, <S%H1406><s%> that you bring <S%H7760><s%> not blood <S%H1818><s%> on your house, <S%H1004><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> any man fall <S%H5307><s%> from there.

You shall not sow <S%H2232><s%> your vineyard <S%H3754><s%> with divers <S%H3610><s%> seeds: lest <S%H6435><s%> the fruit <S%H4395><s%> of your seed <S%H2233><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you have sown, <S%H2232><s%> and the fruit <S%H8393><s%> of your vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> be defiled. <S%H6942><s%>
You shall not plow <S%H2790><s%> with an ox <S%H7794><s%> and an ass <S%H2543><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>
You shall not wear <S%H3847><s%> a garment <S%H8162><s%> of divers <S%H8162><s%> sorts, as of woolen <S%H6785><s%> and linen <S%H6593><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>
You shall make <S%H6213><s%> you fringes <S%H1434><s%> on the four <S%H702><s%> quarters <S%H3671><s%> of your clothing, <S%H3682><s%> with which <S%H834><s%> you cover <S%H3680><s%> yourself.
If <S%H3588><s%> any man <S%H376><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> a wife, <S%H802><s%> and go <S%H935><s%> in to her, and hate <S%H8130><s%> her,

And give <S%H7760><s%> occasions <S%H5949><s%> of speech <S%H1697><s%> against her, and bring <S%H3318><s%> up an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> on her, and say, <S%H559><s%> I took <S%H3947><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> woman, <S%H802><s%> and when I came <S%H7126><s%> to her, I found <S%H4672><s%> her not a maid: <S%H1331><s%>

Then shall the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> and her mother, <S%H517><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> and bring <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> the tokens of the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> virginity <S%H1331><s%> to the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> in the gate: <S%H8179><s%>

And the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> father <S%H1><s%> shall say <S%H559><s%> to the elders, <S%H2205><s%> I gave <S%H5414><s%> my daughter <S%H1323><s%> to this <S%H2088><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to wife, <S%H802><s%> and he hates <S%H8130><s%> her;

And, see, <S%H2009><s%> he has given <S%H7760><s%> occasions <S%H5949><s%> of speech <S%H1697><s%> against her, saying, <S%H559><s%> I found <S%H4672><s%> not your daughter <S%H1323><s%> a maid; <S%H1331><s%> and yet these <S%H428><s%> are the tokens of my daughter's <S%H1323><s%> virginity. <S%H1331><s%> And they shall spread <S%H6566><s%> the cloth <S%H8071><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city. <S%H5892><s%>
And the elders <S%H2205><s%> of that city <S%H5892><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> that man <S%H376><s%> and chastise <S%H3256><s%> him;

And they shall amerce <S%H6064><s%> him in an hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels of silver, <S%H3701><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> them to the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he has brought <S%H3318><s%> up an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> on a virgin <S%H1330><s%> of Israel: <S%H3478><s%> and she shall be his wife; <S%H802><s%> he may <S%H3201><s%> not put <S%H7971><s%> her away all <S%H3605><s%> his days. <S%H3117><s%>
But if <S%H518><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> be true, <S%H571><s%> and the tokens of virginity <S%H1331><s%> be not found <S%H4672><s%> for the damsel: <S%H5291><s%>

Then they shall bring <S%H3318><s%> out the damsel <S%H5291><s%> to the door <S%H6607><s%> of her father's <S%H1><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and the men <S%H582><s%> of her city <S%H5892><s%> shall stone <S%H5619><s%> her with stones <S%H68><s%> that she die: <S%H4191><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> she has worked <S%H6213><s%> folly <S%H5039><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> to play the whore <S%H2181><s%> in her father's <S%H1><s%> house: <S%H1004><s%> so shall you put <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> lying <S%H7901><s%> with a woman <S%H802><s%> married <S%H1166><s%> to an husband, <S%H1167><s%> then they shall both <S%H1571><s%> <S%H8147><s%> of them die, <S%H4191><s%> both the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with the woman, <S%H802><s%> and the woman: <S%H802><s%> so shall you put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin <S%H1330><s%> be betrothed <S%H781><s%> to an husband, <S%H376><s%> and a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> her in the city, <S%H5892><s%> and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her;

Then you shall bring <S%H3318><s%> them both <S%H8147><s%> out to the gate <S%H8179><s%> of that city, <S%H5892><s%> and you shall stone <S%H5619><s%> them with stones <S%H68><s%> that they die; <S%H4191><s%> the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> she cried <S%H6817><s%> not, being in the city; <S%H5892><s%> and the man, <S%H376><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> he has humbled <S%H6031><s%> his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> wife: <S%H802><s%> so you shall put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

But if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> a betrothed <S%H781><s%> damsel <S%H5291><s%> in the field, <S%H7704><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> force <S%H2388><s%> her, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her: then the man <S%H376><s%> only <S%H905><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with her shall die. <S%H4191><s%>

But to the damsel <S%H5291><s%> you shall do nothing; <S%H3808><s%> <S%H1697><s%> there is in the damsel <S%H5291><s%> no <S%H369><s%> sin <S%H2399><s%> worthy of death: <S%H4194><s%> for as when a man <S%H376><s%> rises <S%H6965><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and slays <S%H7523><s%> <S%H5315><s%> him, even so <S%H3651><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> matter: <S%H1697><s%>
For he found <S%H4672><s%> her in the field, <S%H7704><s%> and the betrothed <S%H781><s%> damsel <S%H5291><s%> cried, <S%H6817><s%> and there was none <S%H369><s%> to save <S%H3467><s%> her.

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin, <S%H1330><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is not betrothed, <S%H781><s%> and lay hold <S%H8610><s%> on her, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her, and they be found; <S%H4672><s%>

Then the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with her shall give <S%H5414><s%> to the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> father <S%H1><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels of silver, <S%H3701><s%> and she shall be his wife; <S%H802><s%> because <S%H8478><s%> <S%H834><s%> he has humbled <S%H6031><s%> her, he may <S%H3201><s%> not put <S%H7971><s%> her away all <S%H3605><s%> his days. <S%H3117><s%>
A man <S%H376><s%> shall not take <S%H3947><s%> his father's <S%H1><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> discover <S%H1540><s%> his father's <S%H1><s%> skirt. <S%H3671><s%>
